results.title: Sovereign hill
results.creator_credit: Peter Dodds, Penny Spence and Nine Network
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at Sovereign Hill, Ballarat, this Australian documentary recreates the nineteenth century to explain the historical events surrounding gold discovery in Australia. Produced with the assistance of the Management and Friends of Sovereign Hill Gold Mining Township. A study guide accompanies the video.

results.title: Souvenirs, Souvenirs = Memories, Memories
results.brief_description:
Paris, 1962. Rego Boccara is back from a tour of duty in Algeria and attempts to revive his singing career. His agent, Nadia, must help him fight the animosity of Firmani, an influent music-hall owner, who has vowed never to allow Rego back on stage. Meanwhile, Antoine, Rego’s younger brother, is marking time at the local high school, until the day he meets the new music teacher. This ‘coming of age’ drama is a faithful portraiture of France and its youth culture in the early 1960s. Awards: French Academy of Cinema (Cesar) 1985: Best Promising Young Actor for Pierre-Loup Rajot.

Credits: Producer, Ariel Zeitoun ; director, Ariel Zeitoun ; writer, Daniel Saint-Hamont, Ariel Zeitoun ; photography, Bruno de Keyzer ; music, Cyril Assous, Jean-Paul Dreau ; assistant director, Regis Wargnier.
Cast: Christophe Malavoy, Pierre-Loup Rajot, Claude Brasseur, Annie Girardot, Marlene Jobert, Philippe Noiret, Jean Benguigui.

results.title: Southern run
results.brief_description: A documentary following the everyday duties of a single mother working as a stewardess in the cafeteria of a passenger train. The train stops at Goulburn and Junee stations. Music by Mental As Anything.
results.description: A documentary following the everyday duties of a single mother working as a stewardess in the cafeteria of a passenger train. The train stops at Goulburn and Junee stations. Music by Mental As Anything.

results.title: Southern Belle. Part 2
results.brief_description: This video is the second part of Greg Graingers journey into the Southern part of the United States. Visit states such as Tennessee, Louisiana, Georgia, Alabama, Mississippi, South Carolina and Florida, take time to meet with a wealth of Southern characters and experience the life and customs of the south in a very upbeat and entertaining manner. Visit Dollywood (centre of the business empire of Dolly Parton) and Gracelands (home of the legendary Elvis Presley), paddlewheel down the Mississippi and travel to Nashville for a country music bonanza.

results.title: Southern and Northern Shaolin = Nan Bei Shao Lin
results.creator_credit: Liu Jialiang, Zhao Xianda, Pearl River Film Studio and Shaw Brothers
results.brief_description:
Southern and Northern Shaolin tells the story of how a kung-fu monk, played by Jet Li, and a girl took revenge on an evil warlord. Zhi Ming, a monk in the Northern Shaolin, learns that the warlord who killed his parents is holding a birthday celebration. Without permission, Zhi Ming leaves the monastery and plans to assassinate the warlord. During the assassination attempt, Zhi Ming joins up with Sima Yan and Chao Wei, who come from the Southern Shaolin but have the same agenda. The assassination failed and the three escaped. Zhi Ming found that Sima Yan has a bracelet which is the same as the one on his foot. This means Sima Yan is Zhi Ming’s fiancée as their parents arranged the marriage before their birth. Aware that he is now a monk, Zhi Ming dares not reveal the secret to anybody. In the meantime, the warlord came with troops for a fight. With the help of the kung-fu masters from the Shaolin, Zhi Ming and Sima Yan eventually killed the warlord and took revenge for their parents. Zhi Ming went back to Shaolin with the monks and left his bracelet to Chao Wei, who is in deep love with Sima Yan.

Southern and Northern Shaolin is one of the first Hong Kong and mainland China co-productions. The film has many fighting scenes which showcase the Shaolin kung-fu or Chinese martial arts. This is a great movie for any Chinese kung-fu fans.

The leading actor of the film, Jet Li is one of the best known Chinese kung-fu masters on the big screen (two other well-known figures are Bruce Lee and Jackie Chen). After the release of The Temple of Shaolin, Jet Li became a super film star in mainland China. Jet Li acted in many Hong Kong Kung-fu films in the 1990s before bursting onto the international scene with films such as, The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor and Lethal Weapon 4.

Shaolin Temple is one of the most famous temples in China, not only because of its long history and its role in Chinese Buddhism, but also because of its association with Chinese martial arts. Established in the 5th century, Shaolin Temple is situated in the beautiful Songshan Mountain in Henan province in central north China.

Southern and Northern Shaolin can be seen as a comeback of The Shaolin Temple (1982), which was also jointly produced by mainland China and Hong Kong. Starring also a young Jet Li, The Shaolin Temple was one of China’s best selling movies of all time. (4 stars - Yuxing Zhou; May 21, 2010)

results.title: South: Sir Ernest Shackleton's glorious epic....
results.brief_description: Photographed by Frank Hurley, ‘South’ is the film record of Sir Ernest Shackleton’s heroic but ill-starred attempt to cross Antarctica in 1914-16. It is both a historical document, and a tribute to the indomitable courage of the 28 men who set out on a voyage of discovery that turned into an epic struggle for survival. Silent with original music by Neil Brand.

results.title: Soul collection - back to Stax
results.creator_credit: Stanley Dorfman, Ben Sidran, Clive Woods and Midem Music
results.brief_description: This concert, held in 1990, and filmed at the Palais De Festivale Hall in Cannes, France, is a celebration of the achievements of the legendary record company Stax Records. With a distribution deal from Atlantic Records, Stax produced artists that championed the sounds of soul music around the world. This live memorial concert includes performances from: Booker T and the MGs, Phil Upchurch, Carla Thomas, Eddie Floyd, Memphis Horns and Sam Moore.

results.title: Sophie's choice
results.creator_credit: Alan Pakula, Keith Barish and ITC Entertainment
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by William Styron, this is a remarkably faithful adaptation of the original best-seller. Meryl Streep gives a glorious performance as Sophie Zawistowska, the tragic Polish Catholic beauty, who having survived Auschwitz, has settled in America after World War II. The time is 1947. Stingo (Peter MacNicol), a 22 year-old aspiring writer from rural Virginia, rents a room in a Brooklyn boarding house. He is drawn to his exotic upstairs neighbours, Sophie and Nathan (Kevin Kline), a madly romantic couple whose instability and flamboyance utterly capture this young man’s imagination. The deeper he delves into these people’s lives, the more he learns that each harbours terrible and terrifying secrets. This personalised view of the Holocaust and its devastating effect on one woman who survived it, is a shattering, moving experience.

results.title: Sooty's Christmas party and other stories
results.brief_description: Sooty, Sweep and Soo have a splendid time at Christmas. They arrange a party with their friends and have lots of presents. Father Christmas makes an appearance in a most unlikely place! “Royalty” Sooty and his friends are visited by “royalty”. “Get your skates on” Sooty and his friends go ice skating. Written and presented by Matthew Corbett.
